text:
Funny Fellow

A dim tavern, two men at a table.  
Marmeladov looks distraught.  
Marmeladov: “Why am I not at my duty?”  

Innkeeper: “Why don’t you work?”  
Marmeladov: “My heart aches, I’m a useless worm.”  

---
A flickering candle illuminates their faces.  
Marmeladov: “Have you ever petitioned hopelessly for a loan?”  

Raskolnikov: “Yes, but what do you mean?”  
Marmeladov: “Knowing you’ll get nothing, yet you ask.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Marmeladov reflects on the despair of beggary and the hopelessness of seeking help from others while grappling with his own failures and the consequences of his alcoholism.
